virtual const T9Wrapper* T9InputMapper::GetT9Wrapper (   )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Override this to make the InputMapper use a different T9Wrapper. This expects you to new a specific derived T9Wrapper instance, but of course we should not use new with APOXI, so we actually just return a pointer to a member variable. The disadvantage there is that that member variable is then ignored in derived T9InputMapperClasses. Such things happen when you can't use new.

Implemented in ChineseT9InputMapper, and EnglishT9InputMapper.

virtual T9Wrapper* T9InputMapper::GetT9Wrapper (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Override this to make the InputMapper use a different T9Wrapper.

Implemented in ChineseT9InputMapper, and EnglishT9InputMapper.

BOOLEAN T9InputMapper::IsTextEditorDocument (   )  const [protected]
 

BOOLEAN T9InputMapper::Notify (  NotificationType  type,
INT  index = 0,
const AtomItem *  item = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Is invoked by the editor, if an item has been inserted or the content of the editor has been changed. Overwriting this method allows the input mapper to synchronize its buffer with the editor-content.

Reimplemented from InputMapper.

editor Pointer to the editor the input mapper should belong too. */

Reimplemented from InputMapper.

BOOLEAN T9InputMapper::SetMode_T9_Latin (  t9_language  lang  ) 
 

Sets the language, such as English, German, Greek. But you need the ChineseT9InputMapper instead if you want to use the various Chinese input methods.

Parameters:
For instance, PLDBID_Spanish. The default is PLDBID_English.
Returns:
Whether the method was successful.
